1211.title: Lance Corporal Jake Francis, 21

12112.content:
Jake wakes up in a hospital bed. He tries to recall what happened. He remembers being called for a special assignment but he never found out what the special assignment was. He was jumped on his way and that's all he remembers.

He gets out of bed. He doesn't seem to be injured. He finds his dress uniform and his fatigues in a nearby cabinet. He can't figure it out. How would he have been jumped in the middle of an army base unless the base was under attack? If the base was under attack, why isn't he injured? Also, there are weird things about this hospital room. There are no windows. The walls, ceilings and floors seem coarser, at least for a hospital room. If it wasn't for the standard medical equipment, the room would seem more like a warehouse, not a sterile hospital room.

He calls out, "Should I get dressed?"

He hears a voice, "Please wear your dress uniform. Brass wants to see you."

He dresses. A few minutes later, a military doctor with a rank of captain comes in. "You can dispense with the formalities. I was volunteered the same way you were."

"Volunteered?"

"We're in the super soldier program. I can't go home to my wife and kids. I have to go with you and be your field medic. They experimented on me as well. The name's Dylan but call me Dill."

Jake takes a moment to digest the news but his sense of duty prevents him from violently venting his protest.

What kind of super soldier?
12112.title: Storyline 2

choices: Time to meet the rest of the squad
The general wants photos of Jake in his dress uniform
1211211.content:
Dill leads Jake out of the hospital. The corridor seems strange too, unusually rough but Jake can't identify what it is. The corridor leads directly outside with no lobby, windows, or furnishings of any kind.

The outside is even more bizarre. Dill leads him through a pleasant park with trees and lawns but all the plants are fake. Then Jake identifies what it is about this place. Everything looks like it's part of a diorama. Jake looks up at the blue sky to see that it's a blue painted ceiling. It's a large diorama of a military base except some things are real. Dill and Jake get into a real Jeep and Dill drives it over the fake road. There are other oddities about this military base as well. A few of the buildings look like doll houses bought straight out of a toy store. Behind a sign that says canteen sits a hamburger on a plate instead of a building. Off in the distance, Jake can see giants walking around as if the whole diorama was on a large table in the middle of a large room.

"Why shrunken super soldiers?" Jake asks.

Dill explains, "The way we shrink is not the typical Hollywood method. We are much tougher and stronger than our size would indicate. We're here and the general can demonstrate."

They arrive at the edge of the table under what appears to be a typical army base entry gate. The general is in fatigues but has his rank insignia displayed.

"Yes, I'd be happy to demonstrate." The general picks Jake up and puts him on the floor. The general then steps on Jake using his big field boot. Jake instinctively puts his hands up to push the boot away. Amazingly, this works. The general has to put all his strength into it because Jake keeps the boot from crushing him. The struggle lasts for several minutes before Jake wears out and falls under the boot. Jake gets crushed but surprisingly comes out of it uninjured.

Dill explains, "You're not indestructible but you are no weakling. Only things that could harm you at normal size can harm you shrunken. If a rat attacked you, even though it's bigger than you, you can easily crush it's head between your arms. Plus, you are a much smaller target and significantly less likely to be hit by bullets or other weapons. You're not as fast. If the general were to chase you, he could easily catch you but you can find hiding places more easily. If the general tries to step on you again, a smarter strategy would be to duck into the gaps in his boot tread. You are not more agile. Don't attempt any fancy acrobatics. But if you fall off a table or shelf, you'll be fine."

Devin turned to see where the noise was coming from. It was loud, deep, and not normal. He looked up, staring in shock at what he saw, his pen dropping from his hand.

The clouds... no, the sky was opening up, and a giant metal thing began to come through. It looked like an upside-down building, massive in size, protruding through the opening, lightning flashing around. It stopped and hung there, hundreds of feet above New York.

People began to run away from it, others just stared in horror. Then a loud low noise and a flash erupted from the strange object in the sky.

The light pulsed out in a shockwave, spreading out immensely fast.

"Oh shit!" yelled Sgt. Hacksley, as he turned to run. But it was futile, the wave washed up the street, knocking him off his feet.

Dazed, Devin lay on the ground the wave having knocked him over. Car alarms were going off, people were panicking, windows had shattered.

It was at that point Devin felt strange. Placing a hand to his head, he began to stand up. Little did he know that he...

It was a friday night, and Sheriff David Armstrong was driving his cruiser back to the station, when he suddenly saw a group of teens gathred by the highway. Scowling, he picked up his car radio.

"This is Delta 92, got suspicous activity by the side of the 71, proceding to investigate, over"

15411.title: Calvin Miles, 19

154111.content:
It was 9pm, and Calvin was walking home from his job at the local store. Wearing his red store uniform polo underneath a black hoody, and a pair of jeans and sneakers, Calvin was thinking about how much better things would be when he could drive, then he could quit his shitty job and work somewhere further away. All in all it had been a pretty shitty day, and to make matters worse it was his birthday.

As he walked down the darkened street towards his house, which was darkened because his dad was away on business (his mom left years ago)

Calvin then noticed something strange in the front driveway. It was a bike, and not just any bike. As he got closer he saw it was a shiny red Yamaha R6.

What the hell?

Calvin scowled at the bike. He dropped his backpack and approached it. Taped onto the seat was a sign that read 'Happy Birthday' but it didn't say from who. There was no way his dad had this kind of money.

"Hello?" he called out, expecting someone to pop out. But no one replied. he knelt down and examined the bike.

Liquid-cooled, 4-valve, 4-stroke 4-cylinder.... woah

He stood up and swung his leg over the bike. It was comfortable. As he gripped the handlebars he suddenly felt a shock go through him.

Ah... fuck

He shook his hand at the pain, confused.

Static maybe?
154111.title: Storyline 1

1541111.content:
He looked at his hand, a dark stain on the palm.

There must've been grease on the handle.

But then Calvin did a double take. the patch on his hand was growing. Confused even more, Calvin tried to wipe it off with the other hand, only to watch it spread to the other hand. He then realised it wasn't grease, it was his skin that was turning black.

"What the!...." he panicked, jumping off the motorbike. His skin was becoming black shiny leather, stitching forming along the skin. Calvin realised his hands now looked like a pair of motorcycle gloves. But it didn't stop there, it continued to spread up his arms, a logo appearing in white letters on his forearms, the skin on his elbows thickening to form ribbed elbow pads.

As red stripes appeared from the black leather that was now the skin on his upper arms, Calvin pulled off his hoody and shirt in sheer panic. His shoulders where now black carbon fibre shoulder pads, another logo in silver on top. HIs chest was fast becoming black leather, seams appearing across and down it, with a large red logo on the front, exactly how a bikers leathers looked. As a zip formed down the middle, Calvin tugged at it only to realise that it wouldn't open and hurt if he tried. His nipples became metal studs, his muscles becoming padding and plating underneath the leather. A hump then formed on his back as his torso was entirely biker leathers, and was now spreading down past his crotch to his legs.

Calvin pulled down his jeans and underwear to see to his horror that his penis was gone, and was replaced with a black carbon fibre cup. As his feet became big bulky motorcycle boots, his knees swelling to become knee guards, Calvin felt a different sensation.

His hair was receding into his head, which was growing, larger, rounder, and darker. Calvin realised his head was becoming a helmet. As his facial features became a smooth blacked out glass visor, the transformation reached Calvin's mind.

He suddenly didn't care what was happening, and he felt horny. He pulled off the remains of his sneakers and jeans, looking at his reflection in the darkened window of his house.Feeling his hands over his leathery body, he realised it felt the same as his skin, the metal studs where his nipples where giving him waves of pleasure when he touched them.

He then looked down at his crotch plate. It curved out like a fat bulge, but the carbon fibre was hard to the touch, and sliding his finger along it gave him an immense pleasure. He then realised there was a small hole, like an air vent in the plate, and it began to seep a black shiny liquid.

Oil. I cum oil

He then turned back to the bike, but now looked upon it differently. A strong sexual lust filled him, compelling him to get on it.

WARNING! GRAPHIC CONTENT! 18+ ONLY

This interactive is about men in uniform, undergoing weird transformations as well as hardcore fetish. Emphasis on weird.

Guidelines.

- Naturally, no characters under, or implied to be under the age of 18.

- No female transformations, male characters must stay male in gender identity.

- Straight and bi males allowed, as well as gay.

- Characters must mostly stay in uniform, if possible. Hence the title.

- As well as graphic sex, vore, gore, violence, death, beastiality, water sports, and scat are allowed as long as tagged in story path option (eg. VO, GO, VI ,DE, BE, WS, SC) should you feel so inclined. (If you don't know what those are best to turn back)

- Uniforms vary from culture to culture, and can be complex. A picture, or link to a picture of a man fitting that description/uniform, as well as description would be useful for visual aid.
